alert.note: Alert for Accomack (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 8:37PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Somerset, southwestern Wicomico, southwestern Worcester, central Dorchester and northern Accomack Counties through 930 PM EDT... At 837 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles east of Patuxent River Naval Air Station to Tylerton. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Lawsonia and Deal Island around 850 PM EDT. Marion Station around 855 PM EDT. Westover around 905 PM EDT. Pocomoke City, Princess Anne, and West Pocomoke around 910 PM EDT. University Of Maryland Eastern Shore around 915 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Horntown, Wetipquin, Trinity, Cokesbury, Goodwill, Hoopersville, Greenbackville, Eden, Kingston, and Shelltown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southeastern Maryland...and southeastern Virginia.
